intro: Noronhia sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis Noronhia, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. It is typically found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
